sen.j: 松本長（まつもと ながし、1877年（明治10年）11月11日 - 1935年（昭和10年）11月29日）はシテ方宝生流能楽師。
sen.e: Nagashi MATSUMOTO (November 11, 1877 - November 29, 1935) was Nohgakushi (Noh actor), shite-kata Hosho-ryu (main roles of Hosho school).
Nagashi MATSUMOTO (November 11, 1877 - November 29, 1935) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (principal roles) of Hosho-ryu school.
Nagashi MATSUMOTO (November 11, 1877 - November 29, 1935) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (principal roles) of Hosho-ryu school.

sen.j: 松本金太郎 (能楽師)の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Kintaro MATSUMOTO (Nohgakushi).
He was born as the second son of Kintaro MATSUMOTO (Nohgakushi).
He was born as the second son of Kintaro MATSUMOTO (Nohgakushi).

sen.j: 長男は俳人松本たかし、次男は能楽師松本惠雄（人間国宝）。
sen.e: His first son was Takashi MATSUMOTO, Haiku poet and his second son was Shigeo MATSUMOTO, Nohgakushi (Living National Treasure).
His first son was Takashi MATSUMOTO, Haiku poet and his second son was Shigeo MATSUMOTO, Nohgakushi (Living National Treasure).
His first son was Takashi MATSUMOTO, Haiku poet and his second son was Shigeo MATSUMOTO, Nohgakushi (Living National Treasure).

sen.j: 泉鏡花の従兄に当たる。
sen.e: He was a cousin of Kyoka IZUMI.
He was a cousin of Kyoka IZUMI.
He was a cousin of Kyoka IZUMI.
